author: Rich Chere | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Devils sign goalie Ken Appleby
text:
Comments 
NEWARK â€” The Devils Monday signed goaltender Ken Appleby to a 3-year, entry-level contract. 
Appleby, 20, attended Devils' training camp as an amateur tryout after previously attending the team's development camp in July. He is likely to begin the season at Adirondack (ECHL). 
The 6-5, 215-pound goalie spent the past three seasons with Oshawa (OHL), where he helped lead the Generals to the 2015 Ontario Hockey League and Memorial Cup championships. 
In 2014-15, he led the league with a 2.08 goals-against average, .924 save percentage and six shutouts (tie). He was second with 38 wins. 
RELATED: Devils call Tuesday press conference with Martin Brodeur 
During the OHL Playoffs, Appleby posted a 16-5 mark, with 2 ShO and a 2.24 GAA. This past season, he was the co-recipient of the Dave Pinkney Trophy for fewest team goals against, named to the OHL's Second All-Star Team, Memorial Cup Most Outstanding Goaltender and Memorial Cup All-Star Team. Born April 10, 1995 in North Bay, Ont., his three-season totals showed a 55-18-9 record, with 9 ShO and a 2.28 GAA in 92 regular-season OHL appearances.
